topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Viewing Port Details

body.p: The Ports tab on the Inventory Detail page presents information about the physical ports on a host.
Note: This feature applies only to servers in regionone.
Currently none of the port attributes is configurable; they are all read directly from the hardware.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Inventory tab.
Lock the host to make changes. Click Edit Host then select Lock Host. Wait for the host to be reported as Locked.
In the Host Name column, click the name of the locked host to open the Inventory Detail page for that host.

body.p: Port information is presented in several columns, as follows:

ul.li: Name - The name of the physical port, as identified by the host's Linux kernel.
MAC Address - The port's unique MAC address.
PCI Address - The port's unique address on the PCI bus. Together with the MAC address, this field can be used to uniquely identify a port on the host's hardware platform.
Processor - The processor node that the port's IO controller is connected to.
Auto Negotiation - The status of the Ethernet auto-negotiation flag. Currently, auto-negotiation is always enabled.
Boot Interface - The boot flag, whether or not PXE booting is enabled.
Device Type - Hardware information about the port type, manufacturer, and model.
